Dubai Mainland Company Formation

Tailored Solutions for Your Business Activities

Simplify your business setup in the UAE with our professional, cost-effective solutions. From company formation in Dubai to seamless company registration, we ensure a smooth start for your venture.

Mainland

Company Formation in Dubai Explained

What exactly is a Mainland company in Dubai, and why is it crucial for your business setup? Mainland company formation in Dubai allows businesses to operate within the local market and across the UAE. Licensed by the Department of Economic Development (DED), Mainland companies provide the flexibility to conduct business directly with consumers, secure government contracts, and expand without geographical restrictions. Whether you’re establishing a limited liability company or exploring opportunities as foreign investors, the Dubai Mainland offers a robust platform for growth. Here’s a look at the key benefits and steps involved in setting up your Mainland company!

Flexibility to Operate anywhere in the UAE

One of the key benefits of starting a Mainland company in Dubai is the flexibility it provides. When you register a Mainland company in Dubai, you can conduct business activities across the entire UAE without restrictions. With a Mainland business license, your company can operate freely within local markets, secure government contracts, and expand its reach. The UAE government’s regulations ensure that Mainland companies have the agility to grow and adapt, making it an ideal choice for diverse business activities.

Cost-Effective Licensing Options for Diverse Business needs

Obtaining a Mainland license in Dubai offers cost-effective solutions tailored to your business setup needs. Whether you’re looking to conduct business as a professional or a commercial entity, the flexibility of choosing between a professional license and a commercial license makes it easier to align with your specific business activities. The Mainland license cost is competitively structured, allowing you to operate efficiently while gaining access to the vast local market. This affordability of the business licenses, combined with the ability to conduct business freely, makes setting up on the Dubai Mainland an attractive option.

Versatile Business Structures for Foreign Companies

Mainland company setup in the UAE is ideal for foreign companies seeking versatile business structures. Unlike limited options in free zones, the Mainland allows the formation of various entities, including civil companies, enabling you to engage in diverse business activities. This flexibility is particularly beneficial for companies looking to establish a strong presence in the local market. Whether you’re focused on providing professional services or commercial activities, UAE Mainland company formation offers a dynamic environment for growth and establishment across multiple sectors.

Enhanced Visa Dubai and Residency Options for Business Owners

Securing a Dubai Mainland license offers significant advantages for obtaining residence visas and managing your UAE company’s workforce. Unlike free zone companies, Mainland company setup provides streamlined access to residence visas for owners and employees, aligning with the regulations of the UAE government. This flexibility supports your business activities by enabling you to effectively reach your target market and manage your team. With a Mainland license, you benefit from easier visa processes, helping you build a strong presence in Dubai and the broader UAE.
Steps to Set Up a Business in

Dubai Mainland

Understanding the Dubai Mainland company formation cost and navigating the process of obtaining a trade license are crucial steps compared to a free zone company setup. Here’s a guide from our business setup consultants to the essential steps involved in setting up your business on the Dubai Mainland.

Step 1: Select Your Business Activity

Our experts will guide you in choosing the right business activity in Dubai to align with your goals. Whether you need a professional, commercial, or industrial trade license, we’ll ensure your business license meets the Department of Economic Development requirements for a smooth setup.
2

2. Choose Your Company Structure

Dubai offers a few different business setup options—Mainland, Free Zone, or Offshore. Deciding which one to go with can be a bit tricky, but no need to stress. We’ll take a close look at your company’s activities and preferences to help you pick the perfect fit for your needs.
3

Secure Your Trade License

Getting a trade license in Dubai usually only takes a few days, but to avoid any hiccups, it’s best to leave it to us. We’ll handle the paperwork, and select the right trade license for you, and soon your company will be legally ready to operate. .
4

Obtain Essential Visas and Emirates IDs

We’ll handle the business visa Dubai and Emirates ID application process for you and your team, so you can stay focused on your business. Need a license or UAE visa extension down the line? We can take care of that in no time too.
5

Open Your Corporate Bank Account

With Vision Prime by your side, accessing the Dubai financial market becomes very effortless. With more than 10 bank partners, we’ll assist you with business bank account opening in UAE—and manage the trickier aspects like providing guarantees and controlling payments in the Emirates.

Got a Questions?

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a mainland license in the UAE?

A mainland license in the UAE allows businesses to operate within the local market and engage in a wide range of activities. It is issued by the Department of Economic Development (DED) and provides broader operational freedom compared to free zones.

How much is a Dubai business visa?

The cost of a Dubai business visa varies depending on several factors:

  • Type of visa: there are different types of business visas, each with its own fee structure.
  • Duration of stay: the visa validity affects the cost.
  • Additional fees: medical tests, Emirates ID, and processing fees can add to the overall expense.

 

Generally, you can expect to pay between AED 3,500 to AED 7,500 for a business visa. However, it's essential to consider the additional costs mentioned above. For a more accurate estimate, we highly recommend consulting with a business setup specialist in Dubai.

How is an LLC formed in the UAE?

  1. Choose a Business Activity: determine the specific activities your LLC will undertake. Then, choose a location and reserve a business name.
  2. Appoint a Local Sponsor: a UAE national must hold a 51% share, though profit-sharing arrangements can vary.
  3. Draft Memorandum of Association (MoA): outline company structure, shareholder details, and business activities.
  4. Obtain Necessary Approvals: secure permits and licenses from relevant authorities and submit necessary documents to the DED, before finally opening a corporate bank account.

Note: While this is a general overview, specific requirements and procedures may vary depending on the emirate and type of business. It's advisable to seek guidance from a local business setup consultant like Vision Prime for accurate and up-to-date information.

How long is the business visa valid for in Dubai?

The validity of a Dubai business visa depends on the type of visa:

  • Short-term business visas are typically valid for 30 to 90 days. These are suitable for business meetings, conferences, or initial market research.
  • Long-term business visas can be valid for up to 3 years and are often associated with setting up a business or working in the UAE.

 

It's important to note that visa regulations can change, so it's always recommended to check with the UAE immigration authorities or a business setup consultant for the most current information.

Can you own a 100% business in Dubai?

Yes, you can now own 100% of a business in Dubai.

This is a significant change from previous regulations. However, it's important to note that this applies to specific sectors and activities. It's advisable to check the eligibility of your business activity before proceeding.

 

While free zones have traditionally offered 100% foreign ownership, the recent amendments have extended this possibility to mainland businesses as well, subject to certain conditions.

What is the cheapest way to set up a business in Dubai?

Setting up a business in a free zone is usually the most budget-friendly option in Dubai. Free zones offer various packages with different perks and cost structures.

Here’s a quick breakdown:

  • Free Zones: these zones provide flexible packages that often include office space, visa options, and other benefits. Some popular and cost-effective free zones are:
    • Creative Zone
    • Dubai Media City
    • Sharjah Media City
  • Mainland: setting up a business on the mainland can be pricier because you’ll need a local sponsor and may have higher office space costs. However, it does offer more flexibility in terms of business activities.
  • E-commerce: this can be a low-cost option, especially if you choose a dropshipping model, which means you won’t have to worry about managing inventory or warehousing.

 

Overall, free zones are a great way to keep costs down while still enjoying plenty of benefits.

Can I open a company in the UAE without a residence visa?

Yes, you can open a company in Dubai and conduct business without a residence visa.

In Dubai, foreign entrepreneurs can start a company without needing a residence visa, thanks to the city’s business-friendly environment. You can achieve this by setting up in one of Dubai’s free zones, which offer several perks:

  • 100% Foreign Ownership: you can fully own your business without needing a local sponsor.
  • Simplified Setup: getting your company up and running in a free zone is usually faster and easier than on the mainland.
  • Tax Benefits: many free zones provide corporate tax exemptions.

 

However, keep in mind:

  • Visa Requirements for Business Operations: while you don’t need a residence visa to establish your company, you might need one to visit Dubai for business or to hire employees.
  • Business Activity Restrictions: some business activities might be limited to specific free zones.

How much is a business permit in Dubai?

The cost of a business permit in Dubai can vary widely based on several factors:

  • Type of License: the activities your business will undertake determine the type of license you need, and each comes with different fees.
  • Location: setting up in a free zone is usually more affordable than on the mainland.
  • Business Structure: whether you’re a sole proprietor or forming a limited liability company, the legal structure affects the cost.
  • Additional Fees: don’t forget about extra costs like office space rental, visa fees, and professional services.

 

On average, you might pay between AED 8,000 to AED 30,000 for a basic business license. However, the exact amount can vary based on your specific situation.

For a precise quote, it’s a good idea to consult with a business setup expert in Dubai.

Can I start a business in Dubai without a sponsor?

Yes, You Can Start a Business in Dubai Without a Sponsor.

Dubai has significantly relaxed its business ownership rules. Previously, a local sponsor was mandatory for setting up a business on the mainland. However, recent reforms have made it possible for foreigners to own 100% of their company in many sectors.

 

While free zones have always allowed 100% foreign ownership, the changes now extend to mainland business setups, offering greater flexibility and opportunities for entrepreneurs.

It's essential to note that not all business activities are eligible for 100% foreign ownership. Certain sectors may still require a local sponsor.

To ensure you meet the eligibility criteria, it's advisable to consult with a business setup specialist in Dubai.
